verses.verse: Who hath believed <S%H539><s%> our message <S%H8052><s%>? and to whom hath the arm <S%H2220><s%> of Jehovah <S%H3068><s%> been revealed <S%H1540><s%>?

For he grew up <S%H5927><s%> before <S%H6440><s%> him as a tender plant <S%H3126><s%>, and as a root <S%H8328><s%> out of a dry <S%H6723><s%> ground <S%H776><s%>: he hath no form <S%H8389><s%> nor comeliness <S%H1926><s%>; and when we see <S%H7200><s%> him <S%H4758><s%>, there is no beauty that we should desire him <S%H2530><s%>.

He was despised <S%H959><s%>, and rejected <S%H2310><s%> of men <S%H376><s%>; a man <S%H376><s%> of sorrows <S%H4341><s%>, and acquainted <S%H3045><s%> with grief <S%H2483><s%>: and as <S%H4564><s%> one from whom men hide their face <S%H6440><s%> he was despised <S%H959><s%>; and we esteemed him not <S%H2803><s%>.

Surely <S%H403><s%> he hath borne <S%H5375><s%> our griefs <S%H2483><s%>, and carried <S%H5445><s%> our sorrows <S%H4341><s%>; yet we did esteem <S%H2803><s%> him stricken <S%H5060><s%>, smitten <S%H5221><s%> of God <S%H430><s%>, and afflicted <S%H6031><s%>.

But he was wounded <S%H2490><s%> for our transgressions <S%H6588><s%>, he was bruised <S%H1792><s%> for our iniquities <S%H5771><s%>; the chastisement <S%H4148><s%> of our peace <S%H7965><s%> was upon him <S%H2250><s%>; and with his stripes we are healed <S%H7495><s%>.

All we like sheep <S%H6629><s%> have gone astray <S%H8582><s%>; we have turned <S%H6437><s%> every one <S%H376><s%> to his own way <S%H1870><s%>; and Jehovah <S%H3068><s%> hath laid <S%H6293><s%> on him the iniquity of us all <S%H5771><s%>.

He was oppressed <S%H5065><s%>, yet when he was afflicted <S%H6031><s%> he opened <S%H6605><s%> not his mouth <S%H6310><s%>; as a lamb <S%H7716><s%> that is led <S%H2986><s%> to the slaughter <S%H2874><s%>, and as a sheep <S%H7353><s%> that before <S%H6440><s%> its shearers <S%H1494><s%> is dumb <S%H481><s%>, so he opened <S%H6605><s%> not his mouth <S%H6310><s%>.

By oppression <S%H6115><s%> and judgment <S%H4941><s%> he was taken <S%H3947><s%> away <S%H1755><s%>; and as for his generation, who among them considered <S%H7878><s%> that he was cut off <S%H1504><s%> out of the land <S%H776><s%> of the living <S%H2416><s%> for the transgression <S%H6588><s%> of my people <S%H5971><s%> to whom the stroke was due <S%H5061><s%>?

And they made <S%H5414><s%> his grave <S%H6913><s%> with the wicked <S%H7563><s%>, and with a rich <S%H6223><s%> man in his death <S%H4194><s%>; although he had done <S%H6213><s%> no violence <S%H2555><s%>, neither was any deceit <S%H4820><s%> in his mouth <S%H6310><s%>.

Yet it pleased <S%H2654><s%> Jehovah <S%H3068><s%> to bruise <S%H1792><s%> him <S%H2470><s%>; he hath put him to grief: when thou shalt make <S%H7760><s%> his soul <S%H5315><s%> an offering for sin <S%H817><s%>, he shall see <S%H7200><s%> his seed <S%H2233><s%>, he shall prolong <S%H748><s%> his days <S%H3117><s%>, and the pleasure <S%H2656><s%> of Jehovah <S%H3068><s%> shall prosper <S%H6743><s%> in his hand <S%H3027><s%>.

He shall see <S%H7200><s%> of the travail <S%H5999><s%> of his soul <S%H5315><s%>, and shall be satisfied <S%H7646><s%>: by the knowledge <S%H1847><s%> of himself shall my righteous <S%H6662><s%> servant <S%H5650><s%> justify <S%H6663><s%> many <S%H7227><s%>; and he shall bear <S%H5445><s%> their iniquities <S%H5771><s%>.

Therefore will I divide <S%H2505><s%> him a portion with the great <S%H7227><s%>, and he shall divide <S%H2505><s%> the spoil <S%H7998><s%> with the strong <S%H6099><s%>; because he poured out <S%H6168><s%> his soul <S%H5315><s%> unto death <S%H4194><s%>, and was numbered <S%H4487><s%> with the transgressors <S%H6586><s%>: yet he bare <S%H5375><s%> the sin <S%H2399><s%> of many <S%H7227><s%>, and made intercession <S%H6293><s%> for the transgressors <S%H6586><s%>.
